block.p: NATIONAL SEMICONDUCTOR CORP., Santa Clara, Calif., one of the biggest makers of cell-phone chips, said it had bought the closely held Vivid Semiconductor Inc., Chandler, Ariz., to help it develop products for flat-panel displays. Terms were not disclosed.

CALPINE CORP., San Jose, Calif., a power-plant developer with projects in 27 states and Canada, plans to build and operate a $430 million natural gas-fired 770-megawatt power plant in Haywood County, Tenn.

MINIMED INC., Sylmar, Calif., a maker of insulin pumps for diabetics, said it would split its stock 2 for 1 on Aug. 18 to shareholders of record as of Aug. 2.

ARVINMERITOR INC., Troy, Mich., formed this month by the merger of Arvin Industries Inc. and Meritor Automotive Inc., said it planned to buy back as much as $100 million of its shares. The buyback represents about 6.48 million shares, or 9.1 percent of the 71 million shares outstanding.
